Thank you so much for buying our game! We hope you'll have a lot of fun playing it! Here is a quick tutorial on how to play. Chapters: {0} Use arrows below to move between tutorial stages or close it by clicking "X". You can come back here any time by clicking "?" in the top left corner. To return to this chapter click on DevLife Tutorial.

Welcome to DevLife! Here are some basic camera controls: - Hold RMB - Rotate Camera - Scroll - Zoom Camera - WSAD - Move Camera - Left Shift - Speed-up Camera You can also use arrows on your keyboard: - Arrow Up / Down - Zoom Camera - Arrow Left / Right - Rotate Camera Horizontally - Left Alt + Arrow Up / Down - Rotate Camera Vertically Press F6 to toggle cinematic camera: - E / Q - Move Camera Up / Down - Left Shift - Slow Down Camera - F7 - Take Screenshot
The very first step you should take is assigning you character to the workstation. Click on the Workstation Tracker and then select your employee.
Thanks to Workstation Trackers you can manage your employees, create new projects and learn new skills. Remember that employee must be assigned to a workstation to be able to create projects.

Although you've already selected three skills for your character you cannot use them to create projects. First you must learn how to use them. You have two options to do that: - Buy one of the courses available in the Workstation Tracker -> Learning - Create learning project in the Workstation Tracker -> New Project -> Learning Then choose the skill you want to learn. You need to learn at least one skill by buying a course and complete at least one learning project to proceed.

In DevLife you have many options to customize and upgrade your working space. To do that you need to enter the Build Mode by clicking on it's icon in the bottom panel. Location furnishings and its appearance directly affects the mood of your employees and the effectiveness of their work. It's worth making sure that your workspace looks as good as possible! To place a furniture just Drag and Drop it into the available space. Many furniture have variants which you can choose by clicking RMB on the furniture button to pin the furniture information. If you want to sell furniture press X on your keyboard while dragging it. Use Q and E to rotate the furniture.

In order to create and publish your own projects you will need to create a company. In addition for them to be effective, you'll need to have a large fan base that is willing to buy your product. At the beginning, commissions for external clients will have to be enough for you. To unlock commissions searches you must learn at least one skill by buying a course and complete at least one learning project. First of all you need to search the market for appropriate commissions. Open the Commissions Search window, select commissions search criteria, start the search and then select employee to perform the search. Tip: At the beginning of the game it's advisable to select the "Only Unlocked" option. To be able to select more criteria you will need to upgrade your company. Also remember that some search criteria may be incompatible with each other and therefore prevent you from finding the right commissions.

After you perform a successful commissions search you will get a message with the results. You can also find them in the Commissions Manager.

Click on the found commission to see the details about it and decide whether or not it's worth taking.

You can also reject the offer if you are not interested. Remember that your clients won't wait forever and after some time their offers will expire.

It is good idea to select only one commission at the beginning of your adventure.

When you accept a commission you need to create a new project. To do that click Create Project Button in the Commission Panel or Workstation Tracker -> New Project -> Commercial. In the Project Creator window you need to select all components that are required in the commission. You can also add more components, create your own project (to do that deselect commission) or a learning one.

To start working on a component you need to click on it and assign one of your employees to start creating it. There are many variables that affect the speed of programming. The most important ones are: - Employee Stats - Employee Mood - Component Level - Component Advancement There is a chance of your employee thinking about a solution to a problem in his component. This chance decreases with the component level. There is one more thing that you need to be aware of - Employee Energy. Each action performed by an employee requires energy. It regenerates with time, but if you overwork your employee they will need to go on a vacation. You can add Employee Energy by clicking Workstation Tracker -> Employee -> Add Energy

There is one very important thing that you need to be aware of - Employee Energy. Each action performed by an employee requires energy. It regenerates with time, but if you overwork your employee they will need to go ton a vacation. You can add Employee Energy by clicking Workstation Tracker -> Employee -> Add Energy Option for sending employee for a vacation is in the same tab.

At any point during working on a project you can decide to end it. However, remember that if it's not finished it will have it's repercussions.

If your project is from a commission then you need to finish it before the deadline pass. If you don't make it in time you will get a penalty from commissioner.

Report after each project is available in the Messages window.

After your employee gains enough experience they will advanced to the next level. Each level gives you one skill point which you can use to unlock new skills or upgrade the old ones. To spend your skill points click on the corresponding notification or use Workstation Tracker -> Employee -> Skills If you decide to upgrade your skill it will instantly advance on the next level. Remember that newly bought skill won't be available in projects until you upgrade / learn them on at least 1 level. They also won't increase your employee stats.

The most important goal of the game is to create and manage your own company. To do that you must first finish at least one commission successfully and then meet the required conditions listed in the Create Company panel. Creating company is crucial to unlocking new options and progressing in the game. Thanks to it you will be able to hire more employees and unlock many bonuses that will improve your work. More on that in the Company Upgrades tutorial stage.

To help you with upgrading your company from time to time you will receive goals for your company. You can access the list of Company Goals by hovering over it's icon or by clicking on it to keep it visible all the time. You will get additional money and company Upgrade Points for fulfilling this goals.

In the finance panel you will find all information about your money. After creating your company you will be able to transfer money between your accounts and take bigger loans. To unlock better loans you will first have to unlock corresponding upgrades in the Company Upgrades. More on that in the next tutorial stage.

To access Company Upgrades you can click on the corresponding notification or open your Company Manager -> Company Upgrades. You can select from many upgrades from different categories. Almost every upgrade has it's levels which increase given bonus. To unlock / upgrade one of the upgrades you need to have Company Upgrade Points. You can earn them by finishing Company Goals or leveling up your company.

Creating a company allows you to hire more employees. The whole process of searching for employees is very similar to searching commissions. Choose search criteria, assign employee to perform the search and at the end see the message with the results. Every location has the maximum number of employees which you can have at the time. In first location you can hire only one additional employee. If you want to hire more, you'll have to buy new location. More on that in the next tutorial stage. If you decide that you don't need your employees anymore you can fire them in the Employees Manager. There you will also find more information about the employees you hire. Tip: Remember that some search criteria may be incompatible with each other and therefore prevent you from finding the right candidate.

In current version of the game there are two locations: Family House - your current location and City Center Office. You can travel between location by clicking on the floating arrow at the edge of each map. Every location has it's bonuses but also costs and bills. To see them you need to zoom out the camera to show Location Trackers. There you can find all information about the location and buy it. In the future there will be plenty of new locations available for you to explore! That's the end of tutorial! You can come back here any time by clicking "?" in the top left corner.
Are you sure you want to cancel Interactive Tutorial?

Welcome to DevLife! Thank you so much for buying our game! We hope you'll have fun playing it! In order to make it easier for you to get started, we've prepared this short, Interactive Tutorial, in which you'll learn the basic of game mechanics. To start the Interactive Tutorial, click on the "Let's get going!" button. You know how to play? If so, you can skip the tutorial and go directly into the game. In case of any problems, you can use the text tutorial available after clicking on the "?" icon in the upper left corner of your screen.

Learning Even though your character already has three skills that you chose during the character creation, they cannot be used in projects. To change this, you must first learn them. There are three ways to do that in the game: - Buying courses - Creating learning projects - Upgrading with Skill Points In this tutorial we will show you the first two options. Follow the arrows visible on your screen to proceed.

Time Control Once you have started learning a skill, you need to wait a certain amount of time until your character has completed the selected course. To speed up this process, use the keys from 1 to 4, or click on the arrows at the top of the screen. To pause the game press Space or the Pause button, which is also located at the top of your screen.

Creating Projects The second way to learn new skills is creating learning projects. In addition to them, it is also possible to create projects from commissions, and in the future, after the establishment of your company, also completely own projects! Follow the arrows to open the Project Creator and proceed.
Creating Projects To assign a component to the project, click on it with LMB or drag it to the Selected Components panel. Create your first learning project to proceed.

Assigning Employees to Components Once the project is created, it will appear on the right side of the screen. To start working on its components, you need to assign employees to them. To do this, click on the selected component and then select an employee from the list. Follow the arrows visible on your screen to proceed.

Ending Work on Project At any time after creating a project, you can finish working on it by clicking on the "Release" button. Remember, however, that in the case of commissions and your own commercial projects, the completion rate of the project will affect its outcome. Complete the learning project to proceed.
First Commission You have gained some experience and you know how to create basic components. It's time to search for your first commission. Open the Commissions Search window to proceed.

Commissions Search In DevLife there are many search criteria for commissions. The most important one of them is "Only Unlocked", which will only provide you with commissions that you can complete at the given time. To proceed, start a new commission search with the "Only Unlocked" option checked.

Assigning Employee to Search Just like with working on components, you need to assign one of your employees to continue the search. Click on the commissions search and then select an employee from the list to proceed.

Employee Energy Note that every action your character performs takes the energy. After finishing this tutorial, you will be able to increase its amount in the Workstation Tracker -> Employee -> Add Energy Control the level of energy visible as a green bar above the workstation and let your employees rest from time to time. If the employee's energy is at a low value for a long time, they will become overworked. You can solve that problem by sending them on vacation. This option is also available in the Employee tab. Complete the current commissions search to proceed.

Interactive Tutorial Completed! You have completed your first commissions search and therefore this Interactive Tutorial. You already know the basics of playing DevLife and thanks to that your career in the IT industry can proceed! Your next goal is to accept and fulfill your first commission. You will find the search results in your messages or in the Commissions Manager window. In case of any problems, you can always use the text tutorial available by clicking on the "?" icon just above the messages button. Good luck!

For some time you've felt in yourself that your end is near... Your body has been getting weaker and weaker, but you have always had the serenity and willingness to work. But this moment had to come, you have died. Your adventure in the IT world is over. We hope that by looking back in the past you are satisfied with how your developer's life went.

Thank you so much for playing DevLife and surviving to the end. If you see this message we are really surprised that you had enough constipation to reach this point, especially with the current state of the game :P In the current version, your character's death occurs in a predetermined, older age and does not affect your gameplay. You can easily continue with the game, but we do not guarantee that it will be stable. In the future, however, it will be up to you to decide when your adventure ends, making decisions in various events. We hope that you will look forward to it.

Thank you again for playing! :)
Roman Studio

Another highlight of your trip across the country was the well-known museum of computer technology and video games. You were very excited at the thought of visiting this place. While exploring, a glass display case caught your attention. You weren't sure exactly what it contained, as there was no label visible anywhere. The whole thing is surrounded by a barrier that separates visitors from the mysterious object.

You've tried to lean against the barrier and see what was inside the glass display cage. Unfortunately, you didn't catch your balance and have fallen right onto the exhibit. The structure could not support your weight, and soon you were lying amidst shards of glass. Staff members quickly ran to you to check what happened. The disc that was held there didn't make it. As it turned out, it was the original code of the game called “Spacewar!”. It is considered being the very first video game ever released. It was created back in 1962 by a programmer named Steve Russell. The game ran on the DEC PDP-1 computer and consisted of two spaceships. The goal of the game was to avoid colliding with the star while trying to shoot the other ship with missiles. You didn't hurt yourself, but you will have to pay for some of the damage out of your own pocket. Fortunately, the museum has backups of this code and the first original disc is kept safe under lock and key.

Over the past few years, the space industry has been thriving. One of the visionaries of future space colonization is the CEO, entrepreneur, born in 1964 - Denis Szwarc. His company EarthX has just launched a tourist flight program to low Earth orbit. It's not a cheap trip, but taking part in the first mission will give you plenty of unforgettable experiences, as well as international fame.

After six months of preparation and training, the first fully commercial space tour has been launched! The flight ended with enormous success and the crew got back home safely and earned international fame. Unfortunately, you didn't take part in it, but if you ever change your mind about space travel EarthX is offering more and more cheap flights as space tourism gains popularity around the world!

EarthX is organizing another space tourist flight. Ticket prices are getting cheaper every year and more and more people can afford it. The safety and comfort of the trip have also increased significantly. The question is whether you want to go on this adventure?

After two weeks of waiting you received confirmation of your participation in your first space flight along side some additional details! To your sincere astonishment, you have been appointed the mission captain! During next six months you will receive special astronaut training that will prepare you for the journey. There will be three more people joining you and you will meet them during your first day at the training complex. Without any delay you start packing your things and set off on this unforgettable adventure.

During your first weeks at the astronaut training center you learned about the basics of space travel and got to know your fellow crew members. As the mission captain you will be responsible for communicating with the ground and ensuring the safety and well-being of your crew. Now the time has come to put on actual space suits and go inside the training capsule to get accustomed to the ship itself.
Hmm... I wonder what does this button do...

The next four months of your astronaut training passed very quickly. You learned what to do in case of an emergency and where are the things located on the space ship. The big day has finally come. In a few minutes, you will be flying into space! The count down to launch has begun...

3..., 2..., 1..., 0... Ignition, and liftoff! The moment when powerful engines of the rocket came to life was a life changing experience. The ride to the orbit went smoothly and after making sure that everything was as it should be, you and your crew could finally take a breath and admire the view of the Earth through the big capsule window.

All good things must come to an end. It's the time to prepare for the second most dangerous stage of your first space flight - reentry to the Earth atmosphere. You order your crew to put on their suits, buckle up their seat belts and give green light to the ground control to proceed with reentry...
Brace yourselves, it may shake a little.

Welcome back on Earth! Your reentry to the atmosphere went just as planned and without any complications. After safely splashing down into the ocean and waiting a little bit for the pickup crew you were finally cleared to exit the ship and celebrate success of your first space mission!
I hope I'll get to fly again!

Your part in the first commercial tourist space flight has brought its benefits. You got international fame and many people were interested in you, your history, your life. Through that they also learned about your work and motivated by your accomplishment bought your projects and became loyal fans!

After two weeks of waiting you received confirmation of your participation in your  next space flight along side some additional details! You were once again appointed the mission commander! Because you have already finished astronaut training you won't have to go through the whole process again. The flight is scheduled in six months.
I can't wait to fly again!

The day of your next flight to the Low Earth Orbit has come. You arrived early morning at the space center where the final preparations have begun. Despite already being in space and experiencing the rocket launch, the anticipation is killing you and you can't wait to see the Earth from above once again!

3..., 2..., 1..., 0... Ignition, and liftoff! The moment when powerful engines of the rocket came to life reminded you of your first space flight. The ride to the orbit went smoothly and after making sure that everything was as it should be, you and your crew could finally take a breath and admire the view of the Earth through the big capsule window.
Wow! It's even more breathtaking then I remembered!

All good things must come to an end. It's the time to prepare for the second most dangerous stage of the flight - reentry to the Earth atmosphere. Despite already experiencing it you feel a little bit anxious. But you get it together, order your crew to put on their suits, buckle up their seat belts and give green light to the ground control to proceed with reentry...
Brace yourselves, it may shake a little.

Welcome back on Earth! Your reentry to the atmosphere went just as planned and without any complications. After safely splashing down into the ocean and waiting a little bit for the pickup crew you were finally cleared to exit the ship and celebrate success of your next space mission!

You were pulled out of focus by a sudden, loud sound of your phone ring. Quick glance at the screen showed you an unknown number. Your phone automatically marks it as suspected spam.

Your phone once again rang at an inappropriate time throwing you out of focus. The situation repeats itself - a big, red message on your mobile screen informs you that the number has been marked as potential spam.

A man answers the other end of the phone. In an enthusiastic voice he announces that the city is running a campaign called "Green Energy". He offers to put photovoltaic panels on the roof of your office. Renewable energy will definitely make your electricity bill go away...
With a firm voice announce that you are not interested.
But, wait... How much does it cost?

"Please don't ask about the cost! Ask what you can gain! Doesn't free electricity convince you? The fee will be tailored to your energy needs and it will only be a minor inconvenience. When to schedule an appointment with our representative?"
Well... All right, then. Let's meet as soon as possible!

The man puts the contract on the table and hands you a pen.

Halloween Event! Welcome to the DevLife Halloween Event! It will take place from the 29th of October to the 5th of November. We've prepared a few things for this occasion: - New decorations for Halloween in Build Mode - Spooky soundtrack by GWriterStudio - Special, scary camera filter - No lights in locations during nights - Halloween decorations in the environment - New Steam achievements We hope that you will enjoy it :D Please share your Halloween screenshot with the community on Steam or our Discord server. You can access the Cinematic Camera by pressing F6. Use F7 to take a screenshot. They are stored in Documents/DevLife/Screenshots ;)

Merry Christmas! Welcome to the DevLife Christmas Event! Whether you celebrate Koliada, Yule, Christian Christmas, or just spend your time with loved ones, we hope that you are safe and well. We wish you all the best for this magical time of the year and the years ahead :) The event itself will take place from the 21st of December to the 4th of January and we've prepared a couple of things for this occasion: - New Christmas decorations in Build Mode - Atmospheric soundtrack by GWriterStudio - Snow and Christmas decorations in the environment - New Steam achievements We hope that you will enjoy it :D Remember to share your Christmas screenshot with the community on Steam or our Discord server.
